cmp: 交 (to deliver/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/to pay (money))

exm.mng: to bite words and chew characters (idiom); punctilious about minutiae of wording
gnashing one's teeth (idiom); displaying extreme anger, fuming with rage between gritted teeth
to clench one's teeth, to grind the teeth, gnaw
lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain, to bite the bullet
to arbitrarily assert, to allege, to stick to one's statement, to cling to one's view

exm.cur: 一朝被蛇咬，十年怕井绳
exm.trd: 一朝被蛇咬，十年怕井繩
exm.mng: once bitten by a snake, ten years in fear of a well rope, once bitten, twice shy (idiom)
exm.pyn: yī zhāo bèi shé yǎo , shí nián pà jǐng shéng

exm.mng: to chew, to masticate, to ruminate, to mull over
to commit suicide by biting off one's tongue
variant of 咬嚙|咬啮[yao3 nie4], to gnaw
